newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenyan bank NIC to buy AMBANK.
newsitem.headline: Kenyan bank NIC to buy AMBANK.

text.p: National Industrial Credit Bank Limited (NIC) on Friday announced plans to acquire locally owned African Mercantile Banking Company (AMBANK) by a share swap.
Peter John Bolton, managing director of NIC, said the bank would issue to AMBANK shareholders 11 million five-shilling NIC shares in return for the whole of AMBANK.
"In return, the shareholders (of AMBANK) will get 16.69 percent of the new combined bank," he added.

Ambank's issued share capital is 200 million shillings split into 10 million shares at 20 shillings each. Ambank posted a profit of 55.1 million shillings after tax for the year ended December 31, 1996 while NIC attained 352.0 million shillings after tax for the same period.
The acquisition is expected to be complete in June after approval by the Capital Markets Authority, Monopolies & Mergers Commission, Central Bank of Kenya and NIC shareholders.
NIC's closing price at the Nairobi Stock Exchange was 53 from 52.
